profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:12:09 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 1: Photographs of marble panels for the Alameda County Courthouse in Oakland, California done for the Federal Art Project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reel NDA 3(frames 21-30): Newpaper clippings from San Francisco, Oakland and Los Angeles papers on Simpson's murals and mosaics, 1934 and 1958.[untitled on microfilm]

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel NDA 1 & NDA 3 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel NDA 1: Originals returned to Marian Simpson after microfilming.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reel NDA 3: Originals returned to Lewis Ferbrache after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Marian Simpson (1899-1978) was a painter and mosaicist from Berkeley, Calif. Worked on the Federal Art Project of the Work Projects Administration.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material on reel NDA 1 lent for microfilming 1964 by Marian Simpson; and material on reel NDA 3 lent 1964 by Lewis Ferbrache.
